t: Isaiah 9

Nevertheless,*p there will be no more gloom for those who were in distress. In the past he humbled the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, but in the future he will honor Galilee of the nations, by the Way of the Sea, beyond the Jordan—
The*pn people walking in darkness have*ld seen a great light; on*ln those living in the land of deep darkness a*ld light has dawned.
You*ln have enlarged the nation and*ld increased their joy; they*ln rejoice before you as*ld people rejoice at the harvest, as*ln warriors rejoice when*ld dividing the plunder.
For*ln as in the day of Midian’s defeat, you*ld have shattered the*ln yoke that burdens them, the*ld bar across their shoulders, the*ld rod of their oppressor.
Every*ln warrior’s boot used in battle and*ld every garment rolled in blood will*ln be destined for burning, will*ld be fuel for the fire.

For*ln to us a child is born, to*ld us a son is given, and*ld the government will be on his shoulders. And*ln he will be called Wonderful*ld Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting*ld Father, Prince of Peace.

Of*ln the greatness of his government and peace there*ld will be no end. He*ln will reign on David’s throne and*ld over his kingdom, establishing*ln and upholding it with*ld justice and righteousness from*ld that time on and forever. The*ln zeal of the Lord*s Almighty will*ld accomplish this.
The Lord’s Anger Against Israel
The*pn Lord has sent a message against Jacob; it*ld will fall on Israel.
All*ln the people will know it— Ephraim*ld and the inhabitants of Samaria— who*ln say with pride and*ld arrogance of heart,
“The*ln bricks have fallen down, but*ld we will rebuild with dressed stone; the*ln fig trees have been felled, but*ld we will replace them with cedars.”
But*ln the Lord*s has strengthened Rezin’s foes against them and*ld has spurred their enemies on.
Arameans*ln from the east and Philistines from the west have*ld devoured Israel with open mouth. Yet*pn for all this, his anger is not turned away, his*ld hand is still upraised.
But*pn the people have not returned to him who struck them, nor*ld have they sought the Lord*s Almighty.
So*ln the Lord*s will cut off from Israel both head and tail, both*ld palm branch and reed in a single day;
the*ln elders and dignitaries are the head, the*ld prophets who teach lies are the tail.
Those*ln who guide this people mislead them, and*ld those who are guided are led astray.

Therefore*ln the Lord will take no pleasure in the young men, nor*ld will he pity the fatherless and widows, for*ln everyone is ungodly and wicked, every*ld mouth speaks folly. Yet*pn for all this, his anger is not turned away, his*ld hand is still upraised.
Surely*pn wickedness burns like a fire; it*ld consumes briers and thorns, it*ln sets the forest thickets ablaze, so*ld that it rolls upward in a column of smoke.
By*ln the wrath of the Lord*s Almighty the*ld land will be scorched and*ln the people will be fuel for the fire; they*ld will not spare one another.
On*ln the right they will devour, but*ld still be hungry; on*ln the left they will eat, but*ld not be satisfied. Each*ln will feed on the flesh of their own offspring:
Manasseh*ld will feed on Ephraim, and Ephraim on Manasseh; together*ld they will turn against Judah. Yet*pn for all this, his anger is not turned away, his*ld hand is still upraised.
